page.title: 12OLD BUILDINGS (1)
page.content:
{GLOUCESTER STREET. { } Gloucester Street in New Hartley,was built in {1914}along with Bristol St,which faced Melton Terrace. They ran{NE-SW. Originally it was built as colliery housing,but when the First World War took its toll, Gloucester Street was used to house{Horse Regiments}of soldiers. The Soldiers used what are now the upstairs bedrooms as living rooms whilst their horses were stabled downstairs. The street is named after the{ {Gloucester Regiment. { }After the War they were not needed and were rented out as dwellings before being sold to private owners.
(CONTINUED)
